Description: Sample Collection ID that also links the sample collection to the hosting biobank or study
Short name in use for the sample collection
The name of the sample collection in english
A description of the sample collection. Recommendation max. 2000 char.
The sex of the individuals in the sample collection. Can be one or more of the following values: Male, Female, Unknown, Undiferrentiated MIABIS-2.0-09
Age of youngest sample donor at time of sample donation
Age of oldest sample donor at time of sample donation
Unit defining Age Low and Age High. Can be one of the following values: years, months, weeks, days
The data catagories from which data is available. Can be several values MIABIS-2.0-3
The biospecimen saved from a biological entity for propagation e.g. testing, diagnostics, treatment or research purposes. Can be several values MIABIS-2.0-14
The long term storage temperature at which the samples are stored after preparation. Can be several values:MIABIS-2.0-15
The type of the sample collection. Can be several values MIABIS-2.0-16
The disease of main interest in the sample collection, if any. Can be several values as defined in MIABIS-2.0-17
Contact information for the contact person of the sample collection MIABIS-2.0-07and MIABIS-2.0-23 of the PI
The unique ID or acronym of the study
The name of the study in English
A description of the study aim. Recommendation max. 2000 char.
The name of the person responsible for the study e.g. the principal investigator
Contact information for the contact person of the study MIABIS-2.0-07 and MIABIS-2.0-23
The design of the study. Can be one or several values: MIABIS-2.0-19
The type of data that is associated with the samples in the study. Can be several values MIABIS-2.0-13
The biospecimen saved from a biological entity for propagation e.g. testing, diagnostics, treatment or research purposes. Can be several values MIABIS-2.0-14
Total number of individuals recruited to the study
Total number of individuals with biological samples in the study
Information on type of parameters that determine which individuals will become study participants. Can be several valuesMIABIS-2.0-22
Unique ID of the sample within a sample collection, often represented by the sample barcode; text identifier, recommendation maximum 30 characters.
Unique ID within a sample collection of a parent sample. Only if the sample has a parent sample i.e. if the sample itself is an aliquot or a derivative from another sample.
The biospecimen type saved from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes. Can be several values MIABIS-2.0-14
The long term storage temperature at which the samples are stored after preparation. Can be several values:MIABIS-2.0-15
The time when the sample is taken according to ISO 8601 i.e. YYYYMMDDThhmm
The anatomical position of the body where the solid sample was taken from. MIABIS-44
The sex of the study participants. Can be one or more of the following values: Male, Female, Unknown, UndiferrentiatedMIABIS-2.0-09
Age of the youngest study participant at time of inclusion
Unit defining Age Low and Age High. Can be one of the following values: years, months, weeks, days
Name of ontology used for disease. Can be several values e.g. ICD, SNOMED
Version of selected ontology for disease e.g. ICD-9, ICD-10, SNOMED-CT
Disease code from the selected Disease Ontology Version e.g. C61
Description from the selected Disease Ontology Code e.g : Malignant neoplasm of prostate
Explanation about disease or symptom in case of unknown disease or insufficient information
Textual string of letters denoting the first name of the Contact
Textual string of letters denoting the last name of the Contact
Phone to the Contact including international call prefix
Email address of the Contact person
Street name and street number or PO Box of the Contact person
ZIP of the Contact person
City of the Contact person
Country of the Contact person
